intro: Paederia lanata, commonly known as the hairy paederia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Paederia lanata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
